definition: head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc

sentences.english: Did you mean Narendra Modi, Gujarat Chief Minister?
sentences.chinese: 您说到吉拉特邦首席部长，纳伦德拉莫迪？

sentences.english: That said, I recommend this book to anyone who is the family CFO.
sentences.chinese: 总的说来，我推荐这本《如何成为家庭首席财务官》。

sentences.english: Because, you’ve become the CEO of your life.
sentences.chinese: 因为，你已经成为自己生命的首席执行官。

sentences.english: The BBC's chief football correspondent Mike Ingham has more.
sentences.chinese: BBC首席足球记者迈克因格汉姆报道。

sentences.english: Example : Obama's chief China advisor is an experienced China hand.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马的首席中国问题顾问是个经验丰富的中国通。

sentences.english: That includes setting the compensation of the chief executive.
sentences.chinese: 其中包括设定首席执行官的补偿金。

sentences.english: Now they have dozens, collectively called the “c-suite”.
sentences.chinese: 如今竟有了几十个，合起来称为“首席团队”。

sentences.english: The new CFO was sent to bring the company out of the red.
sentences.chinese: 任命新的首席财务官是要把公司从赤字中拯救过来。

sentences.english: Finally, he called the name of the senator from Kansas.
sentences.chinese: 最后，首席大法官叫到了这位堪萨斯州参议员的名字。

sentences.english: Spain’s World Cup-winning club contained seven Barcelona first-teamers.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙世界杯优胜俱乐部已有七名巴塞的首席队员。

sentences.english: Does the CTO write a blog?
sentences.chinese: 那个首席技术官写不写博客呢？

sentences.english: CHARLIE BELL became chief executive of McDonald\'s in April.
sentences.chinese: 查理贝尔于4月份成为了麦当劳的首席执行官。

sentences.english: Pang is the chief executive of PEMGroup.
sentences.chinese: 彭日成是保盛丰的首席执行长。

sentences.english: Gail: I’m the CMO for Asco International.
sentences.chinese: 我是Asco国际公司的首席营销官。

sentences.english: The incidents follow a similar one in January that killed another top nuclear scientist.
sentences.chinese: 这些事件按照一月份的杀了一个类似的首席核科学家。

sentences.english: The average chief marketing officer lasts just two years and two months.
sentences.chinese: 首席营销官平均两年又两个月一换。

definition: double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time
to hold a governmental office or post/to assume office of/to take charge of/to serve as
specially engaged/employed or commissioned for a special task
head/director (of an organizational unit)/(police) commissioner/inspector-general/rank of local governor in Tang dynasty administration
vice-chairman (of an organization)/vice president (of a company)/deputy governor (of a bank)
to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
to take up a post/to start in a new job
to occupy a post currently/current (president etc)/incumbent/(coll.) current boyfriend (girlfriend, spouse)
